intro: Sphaerostephanos hirtisorus, commonly known as the hairy-haired star-flower, is a rare and unique member of the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
